headline.main: 3 JAPANESE SHIPS SUNK IN SOLOMONS; Our Bombers Damage a Fourth in Attack on Convoy Trying to Run Blockade

lead_paragraph: ALLIED HEADQUARTERS IN THE SOUTHWEST PACIFIC, Saturday, Oct. 2 -- Bombers destroyed three ships and damaged a fourth from a Japanese convoy attempting to run the Allies' central Solomons blockade, a communique disclosed today, and on Vella Lavella Island in the Solomons and around Finschhafen in New Guinea ground forces were closing in on Japanese centers of resistance.
abstract: Australian troops near Cape Cretin in drive on Finschhafen; other units reach Ramu River valley near Marawasa; Jap planes make futile raid over Sattelberg area; Allied planes raid Garove and Rooke Islands
